p: We first examine the relationship between the average susceptibility ( β), the basic reproduction number ( R 0) and the epidemic size ( FI ∞); see Fig 4. We note that Eq (16) predicts a linear relationship between R 0 and β. As can be seen in Fig 4(a), most ( E, V) pairs have β < 2 × 10 −4 person −1 day −1, while pairs with higher values of β correspond to those with large epidemic sizes ( FI ∞ > 0.6). These pairs have R 0 > 7, implying β > 2.33 × 10 −4 person −1 day −1 from Eq (20).
